resources.string: Select a network if you would like to connect to Wi-Fi.
Select a network below to use Wi-Fi or press the back key to stay on the mobile network. To change the setting press the menu key to go to Wi-Fi settings.
When opening apps, tell me when Wi-Fi is available.
Notify me when an AT&T Wi-Fi Hotspot is available
Automatically connect to an available AT&T Wi-Fi Hotspot

"Mobile Wi-Fi hotspot allows your Android-powered device to be used as a mobile hotspot for up to five devices using your phone's data connection. If using this service, you should secure the connection to deny unauthorised access. This service consumes battery power and increases your data usage. This service requires a subscription to the applicable modem plan. Please ensure you have subscribed to the appropriate data plan prior to use. Call 1-888-944-9400 if you need assistance. Use of service constitutes acceptance of the"Smartphone Modem Terms.

"Tethering allows your Android-powered device to be used as a modem to access the Internet on your laptop while on the go. This feature consumes battery power and increases your data usage. This service requires a subscription to the applicable modem plan. Please ensure you have subscribed to the appropriate data plan prior to use. Call 1-888-944-9400 if you need assistance. Use of service constitutes acceptance of the"Smartphone Modem Terms.
PIN must not be repetitious (1111) or sequential (1234).
Password must not be repetitious (aaaa) or sequential (abcd).
"Created group, visible to all Wi‑Fi capable devices. WPA2 password: %1$s"
Not visible to other non Wi-Fi Direct devices.
Press the Wi‑Fi Protected Setup button on your phone
Enter PIN %1$s on the other Wi-Fi capable device. Setup can take up to two minutes to complete.
WPS succeeded. The other device connected to network.
Another WPS session was detected. Please try again in a few minutes.
Limit number of Wi-Fi Direct devices to improve performance
Wi-Fi Direct auto-connect will impact battery life.
Enabling NFC will allow data exchange when you touch another NFC device. Make sure you know and trust the person with whom you are exchanging information as it may be accessible to third parties.
Do you want to enable NFC?

To automatically switch to the mobile network when this happens, turn on Avoid bad Wi-Fi connections in the Advanced Wi-Fi Settings.

Broadcasting uses low-power Bluetooth signals."

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media and other files. After you encrypt your phone, assuming you've set up a screen lock (that is, a pattern or numeric PIN or password), you'll need to unlock the screen to decrypt the phone every time you power it on. The only other way to decrypt is to perform a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in throughout the process. If you interrupt it, you'll lose some or all of your data."
Please charge your battery and try again.
Please plug in your charger and try again.
No lock screen PIN or password
You need to set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
You need to draw your unlock pattern to confirm encrypting your device.
"The encryption operation is irreversible and, if you interrupt it, you'll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times."
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. Time remaining: ^1
To unlock your phone, turn it off and then on.
Warning: Your device will be wiped after ^1 more failed attempts to be unlocked!

"Encryption was interrupted and can't be completed. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts and more.
Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

"To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, Google and other apps may scan for nearby networks, even when Wi-Fi is off. If you don't want this to happen, go to Advanced > Scanning always available."
"Apps may scan for nearby networks, even when Wi-Fi is off. If you don't want this to happen, go to Advanced > Scanning always available."

Press the Wi‑Fi Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \"WPS\" or contain this symbol:
Enter PIN %1$s on your Wi‑Fi router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.

"No Internet Access Detected, won't automatically reconnect."

Your phone won't have an Internet connection.
You won't get software updates until you connect to the Internet.
You can't activate device protection features at this time."

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can: "
"Pan: drag two or more fingers across the screen. "
Adjust zoom level: pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: triple tap for magnification works everywhere except on the keyboard and navigation bar."

"When this feature is turned on, you can quickly enable accessibility features in two steps:
Step 1: press and hold the power button until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.
Step 2: touch and hold with two fingers until you hear audio confirmation.
If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked."
Update screen magnification on app transitions
Use press and hold for menu

Battery use is an approximation of power use and does not include every source of battery drain. Miscellaneous is the difference between the computed approximate power use and the actual drain observed on the battery.

Disable background data on mobile networks.
To restrict background data for this app, first set a mobile data limit.

"This feature may cause an app that depends on background data to stop working when only mobile networks are available.
You can find more appropriate data usage controls in the settings available within the app."
"Restricting background data is possible only when you've set a mobile data limit."

"Any changes that you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes that you make on the phone to the web. A Google Account works this way."
"This will conserve data and battery usage, but you'll need to sync each account manually to collect recent information and you won't receive notifications when updates occur."

"Your phone will turn off mobile data once it reaches the limit that you set.
Since data usage is measured by your phone, and your operator may account for usage differently, consider setting a conservative limit."
"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to Wi‑Fi."

"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to Wi‑Fi.
This setting affects all users on this phone."
"%2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your phone. Your carrier's data usage accounting may differ."
Metered networks are treated like mobile networks when background data is restricted. Apps may warn before using these networks for large downloads.
To select metered networks, turn Wi‑Fi on.
Operator data accounting may differ from your device.
Select a VPN profile to always remain connected to. Network traffic will only be allowed when connected to this VPN.

"This device is managed by: %s

A trusted credential installed on your device is making this possible."
"Before you can create a restricted profile, you'll need to set up a screen lock to protect your apps and personal data."
Users have their own apps and content
You can restrict access to apps and content from your account

"You can share this device with other people by creating additional users. Each user has their own space, which they can customise with their own apps, wallpaper and so on. Users can also adjust device settings such as Wi‑Fi that affect everyone.
When you add a new user, that person needs to set up their space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."

"When you add a new user, that person needs to set up their space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."
Make sure that the person is available to take the device and set up their space
"Only the phone's owner can manage users."

"When this setting is turned on, you can use screen pinning to keep the current screen in view until you unpin.
To use screen pinning:
1. Make sure that screen pinning is turned on.
2. Open the screen that you want to pin.
3. Touch Overview.
4. Swipe up and then touch the pin icon."

"You can further protect this device by requiring your PIN before it starts up. Until the device starts up, it can't receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.
This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices."

"In addition to a screen lock, you can use a SIM PIN to prevent access to mobile networks. Your SIM card came with a default PIN from your carrier. In order to use mobile services, you must enter the PIN whenever you swap SIM cards or restart your device.
"Warning": if you enter an incorrect PIN code multiple times, your SIM card will be completely disabled.
You will then need to obtain a PIN Unlock Key (PUK) from your carrier to enable your SIM card again."
